comment:
* APF program support capabilities. APF stands for Android Packet Filtering and it is a flexible
 * way to drop unwanted network packets to save power.
 *
 * See documentation at hardware/google/apf/apf.h
 *
 * This class is immutable.
 * @hide

variables.name: apfVersionSupported
variables.comment:
* Version of APF instruction set supported for packet filtering. 0 indicates no support for
     * packet filtering using APF programs.

variables.name: maximumApfProgramSize
variables.comment: * Maximum size of APF program allowed.

variables.name: apfPacketFormat
variables.comment: * Format of packets passed to APF filter. Should be one of ARPHRD_*

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)
public boolean hasDataAccess()
methods.comment:
* Determines whether the APF interpreter advertises support for the data buffer access opcodes
     * LDDW (LoaD Data Word) and STDW (STore Data Word). Full LDDW (LoaD Data Word) and
     * STDW (STore Data Word) support is present from APFv4 on.
     *
     * @return {@code true} if the IWifiStaIface#readApfPacketFilterData is supported.

methods.name: public static boolean getApfDrop8023Frames()
methods.comment: * @return Whether the APF Filter in the device should filter out IEEE 802.3 Frames.

methods.name: public static int[] getApfEtherTypeBlackList()
methods.comment: * @return An array of blacklisted EtherType, packets with EtherTypes within it will be dropped.

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)
